duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct physical therapy to patients, evaluating and treating individuals with a focus on restoring function following trauma or disease.
Use special physical therapy tests and measurements to evaluate patients and develop treatment plans.
Administer physical therapy treatments using various techniques such as therapeutic exercise, manual therapy, and modalities to relieve pain and restore function.
Document patient treatment data, progress notes, and discharge summaries.
Instruct patients and their families in home program and supervise patient's plan of care when carried out by a physical therapist assistant.
Represent department in meetings, attend patient care conferences, and provide in-services for other hospital departments.
Use effective time management to complete patient care assignments and meet departmental productivity standards.
Participate in professional activities for continued self-development and growth of technical knowledge and skills.
Maintain an optimistic and professional image, and exhibit excellent customer relations to patients, visitors, physicians, and co-workers.
Conform to the service expectation policy and adhere to safety protocols and safe delivery of care.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of a physical therapy educational program approved by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
Licensed physical therapist in the State of South Carolina by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
